sentences: Riyu Kosaka (小坂 りゆ（小坂 梨由）, Kosaka Riyu, born January 17, 1985) is a Japanese pop singer and lyricist.
Kosaka was born in Yokohama, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan on January 17, 1985.

On November 20, 2000, Konami and Toshiba-EMI staff held auditions to form a J-pop group, which would eventually become BeForU;  Riyu, who was then fifteen years old, was one of four who went on to join the group.

On November 20, 2000, Konami and Toshiba-EMI staff held auditions to form a J-pop group, which would eventually become BeForU;  Riyu, who was then fifteen years old, was one of four who went on to join the group.
Trance Sunrise Mix.
including a long version of both the radio edit and the trance sunrise mix, as well as a remix of a solo performance of Dive, renamed Dive to the Night.
including a long version of both the radio edit and the trance sunrise mix, as well as a remix of a solo performance of Dive, renamed Dive to the Night.
In 2004, the band's first CD was released, containing some solo work by Kosaka; in the same year, her first full solo album, Begin, was released.
In 2004, the band's first CD was released, containing some solo work by Kosaka; in the same year, her first full solo album, Begin, was released.
A year later, she released Riyu Kosaka First Live at O-EAST 2005, a CD+DVD set of her first full-blown concert.
A year later, she released Riyu Kosaka First Live at O-EAST 2005, a CD+DVD set of her first full-blown concert.
In 2005 and 2006, she also collaborated with Ryo Horikawa as a radio personality for Pakedio Channel, and her song Little Wings is available on the album Pakedio Channel Vol.
In 2007, Riyu Kosaka recorded a song for the film Kamen Rider The Next, Platinum Smile.
In December 2007, Riyu released her sixth single, Kokoro no ato.
In 2008, Riyu released her second studio album, Every Struggle, which was also her debut album on a major record label.
Due to the break-up of BeForU in late 2008, Riyu did not produce any solo works for some time.
In 2010, Riyu announced the release of her song 'キミが聞こえる' which would be featured on 'あまつみそらに!'
as the ending theme and was also released as part of the soundtrack in June 2010.
In 2018, she provided vocals on the Dynamite Dynamite Rev -NAOKI SPECIAL ALBUM-.
In 2019, she provided vocals for the opening song of the mobile game Seven's Code.
In 2021, the song 12 by Naoki and Riyu Kosaka that was in Seven's Code reappears on the game StepManiaX.
